intro: Tanacetopsis setacea, commonly known as the slender tansy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It features slender, erect stems with finely divided, aromatic leaves. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in flat-topped clusters, making it a distinctive and ornamental species.
